PACJA - Kapacitetsutv. för civila samhällets deltagande i klimatförhandlingar

description.narrative: Stödet till PACJA är ett organisationsstöd som kommer att stödja organisationen i utvecklingen av institutionell kapacitet för att koordinera andra civila samhällsorganisationer i Afrika i en strävan mot rimlighet och rättvisa inom klimatförändring. Medlen ska göra det möjligt att ha ett verksamt sekretariat, en bra koordineringsmekanism, och stöd till gräsrotsorganisationers aktivite

The support to PACJA is a core support that will support the organization develop institutional capacity to coordinate other civil society organizations in Africa to pursue fairness and justice in climate change. The funds are to enable it have a working secretariat, a good coordination mechanism, and support to grassroots activities that are to be undertaken in partnership with its members.

description.narrative: In July 2012, the Embassy of Sweden, Nairobi signed an agreement with PACJA to support a contribution, “Capacity-Building for African CSOs for Effective Engagement in Climate Dialogue and Policy Processes”. The activity period was for the period 01 July 2012 to 31 August 2017. During this time the agreement has been amended two times (on 1st July 2016 and later 1st January 2017) as a cost extension period to the agreement. The first cost extension was handled by the Embassy of Sweden Nairobi while the second cost extension was handled by the Embassy of Sweden Addis-Ababa following the transfer of Sida regional office from Nairobi to Addis Ababa. The cost extension support sought to finalize outstanding project activities, finalizing the project document for the Sida long-term support and to strengthen the African civil society engagement in implementation of the Paris Agreement. The project has since 2012 conducted many complementary activities. As an outcome of this process the convening power of PACJA has had an enduring legacy in other Multilateral Environmental Agreements (MEAs), notably UNEP, whose Regional Office for Africa (RoA) hosts the Secretariat of African Ministerial Conference on the environment (AMCEN). During the project period, PACJA’s coordination and mobilization capacity has improved. This has seen the Alliance play a major role as the de facto Convener of UNEP-RoA Major Groups and Stakeholders Forum (MGSF). This strategic positioning has provided an entry point for broader continental and regional outreach between NSA´s and Governments, since AMCEN is the recognized arm for the environment of the African Union. PACJA have used these forums for post-COP reflection, feedback and analysis. PACJA has developed a respected clout within the Intergovernmental policy-making processes in Africa. This already presents a major test in responding to the growing demands from stakeholders. A pool of well-trained, competent and dedicated experts from all sectors and thematic areas is required to provide analysis of issues and events on periodic basis. Though an attempt has been made to build such a team within the Technical and Political Affairs Committee (TAPAC) of PACJA, little progress has been made owing to various factors, among the lack of sufficient resources to recruit and retain experts, and inexistence of such expertise. PACJA´s engagement with REC’s offers an innovative approach to addressing some complex issues relating to climate change and regional intervention strategies. The strategy to develop partnerships with RECs can be sighted as a tool enhancing regional ownership and should be perceived as a pragmatic key step in contributing to regional integrations not only by governments but also CSOs development efforts in such regions. In a nutshell, key achievements can be summarized as: - Sufficiently improved capacity and efficiency in the attainment of the mission, vision and objectives of PACJA. Enhanced and positive media coverage of Africa climate change issues. Enhanced visibility of equitable, people centered and ambitious international climate policies/strategies responsive to African realities and concerns with respect to intensification of political engagement and provisions of the Paris Agreement and Pre-2020 ambitions. Emergence of PACJA Alliance as an indisputable platform for information sharing providing strategic intervention in key governmental processes at national, sub-regional, regional and international levels. The alliance operates in 45 countries bringing together over 1000 CSOs. Enhanced elaboration of climate change adaptation solutions and the production of Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) handbook for use by African governments and relevant decision makers.
